questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an Attendance Report?
options: To track the presence, absence, and leaves of individuals over a period
questions.explanation: An attendance report is a record used to monitor regularity and punctuality of students or employees.

questions.question: Which Excel function is best suited to count the number of days a student was 'Present' (marked as 'P')?
questions.explanation: COUNTIF counts the number of cells within a range that meet a specific condition (e.g., cell content is 'P').

questions.question: You want all cells containing 'A' (Absent) to automatically turn red. Which feature should you use?
questions.explanation: Conditional Formatting allows you to set rules (like 'Text that contains A') to apply specific formatting (Red fill) automatically.

questions.question: In an attendance sheet, if you want to ensure users can ONLY type 'P', 'A', or 'L', what feature should you use?
questions.explanation: Data Validation with the 'List' option restricts user input to a predefined set of choices.

questions.question: Which feature helps keep the student names visible on the left while you scroll to view dates on the far right?
questions.explanation: Freezing the first column ensures that names remain locked in view while scrolling horizontally.

questions.question: What is a 'Biometric Attendance System'?
options: A digital system that uses fingerprints, iris scans, or face recognition to mark attendance
questions.explanation: Biometric systems use unique biological traits to verify identity and mark attendance, preventing 'buddy punching'.

questions.question: To calculate the 'Attendance Percentage', which formula logic is correct?
questions.explanation: Percentage is calculated by dividing the part (Days Present) by the whole (Total Working Days) and multiplying by 100.

questions.question: If you drag the 'Fill Handle' across a row starting with 'Mon', what will Excel do?
questions.explanation: Excel's AutoFill feature recognizes days of the week and continues the sequence automatically.

questions.question: Which page orientation is usually best for printing a wide Monthly Attendance Sheet?
questions.explanation: Since attendance sheets have many columns (30/31 days), Landscape orientation provides more horizontal space.

questions.question: What is a potential disadvantage of a manual paper-based attendance register?
options: It is prone to errors, damage, and makes calculation time-consuming
questions.explanation: Manual registers can be lost, damaged, or manipulated, and calculating totals at the end of the month is slow.

questions.question: In Excel, to enter the current date quickly into a cell, which shortcut can be used?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + ; inserts the current static date into the active cell.

questions.question: If a student is marked 'L' (Leave), how does it typically affect the 'Absent' count?
options: It is usually tracked separately from unjustified Absences
questions.explanation: Leaves are authorized absences and are usually tallied separately from unauthorized 'Absent' days.

questions.question: AI-powered Facial Recognition attendance systems provide which benefit?
questions.explanation: Facial recognition is touch-free, reducing the spread of germs compared to fingerprint scanners or signing papers.

questions.question: To quickly see how many students are absent on a specific day, you can select the column and look at the:
questions.explanation: The Status Bar at the bottom of Excel shows quick stats like Count or Sum for selected cells.

questions.question: Which border style is commonly used to separate the header row (Dates) from the data (Attendance marks)?
questions.explanation: A thick bottom border under headers helps visually separate labels from the data.

questions.question: What happens if you use the 'Merge & Center' button on the title 'Attendance Report' across columns A to AE?
options: It centers the title across all the selected columns in one large cell
questions.explanation: Merge & Center is standard for centering titles across the width of a table.

questions.question: If you want to protect your attendance sheet so others can look but not change marks, what feature do you use?
questions.explanation: Protect Sheet restricts editing capabilities, ensuring data integrity.

questions.question: Why might an organization link Attendance Reports to Payroll?
options: To calculate salary deductions for unpaid leaves
questions.explanation: Attendance data directly impacts salary calculations based on days worked vs. days absent.

questions.question: Which function allows you to join a First Name and Last Name column into one 'Full Name' column for the report?
questions.explanation: CONCAT (Concatenate) is used to combine text strings from different cells.

questions.question: When designing the sheet, 'AutoFit Column Width' is useful for:
options: Making all columns the same size
Shrinking columns to fit the content (like 'P' or 'A') tightly to save space
questions.explanation: AutoFit adjusts the width to match the content, which is crucial when fitting 31 days onto one screen/page.
